titlestmt.titleproper: American Chemical Society Division of Petroleum Chemistry records 1928-2001
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: American Chemical Society Division of Petroleum Chemistry records

bioghist.p: The American Chemical Society (ACS), founded in 1876, is a self-governed individual membership organization that consists of more than 158,000 members at all degree levels and in all fields of chemistry. The Division of Petroleum Chemistry is one of the 33 technical divisions within the ACS. The division has approximately 1,400 members and provides a network for scientists and engineers interested in the chemistry of petroleum exploration, production, refining, and utilization.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records from the ACS Division of Petroleum Chemistry. Materials include preprints (1928, 1943-2001), newsletters (1944-2001), and banquet programs (1955, 1973, 1977-1997).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
